content:
• Thursday, November 15, 2012
  • ATW

    More on Atwood Oceanics (NYSE:ATW): FQ4 blows out both top and and bottom line estimates as...

    More on Atwood Oceanics (NYSE:ATW): FQ4 blows out both top and and bottom line estimates as total revenue jumps 42% Y/Y. Drilling revenues were strong, with company bringing two new rigs on line during the quarter: the Attwood Mako and the Atwood Condor in the Gulf of Mexico. Shares +5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:32 PM
  • PENN

    Penn National Gaming (NASDAQ:PENN) plans to split in two, separating its real estate assets from...

    Penn National Gaming (NASDAQ:PENN) plans to split in two, separating its real estate assets from its operating assets via a publicly traded REIT and distribution of a $15.40/share dividend. PENN also says it submitted a proposal to Pennsylvania regulators for a $480M casino in Philadelphia. After a trading halt, shares +16.9% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:09 PM | 1 Comment
  • EMAN

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: EMAN +5.8%. ARUN +5.4%. KCG +4.2%. GPS +3.1%. VELT...

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: EMAN +5.8%. ARUN +5.4%. KCG +4.2%. GPS +3.1%. VELT +2.9%.
    After-hours top losers: AAT -9.2%. CUBE -7.4%. SINA -6.2%. CTRX -5.6%. SHLD -5.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:42 PM
  • SHLDQ

    More on Sears (SHLD): Q3 beats on all counts, but net losses widened as same-store sales...

    More on Sears (SHLD): Q3 beats on all counts, but net losses widened as same-store sales continued to weaken and a tax-benefit helped skew year-ago results. A weak economy continues to hurt demand. In the latest period, overall domestic same-store sales declined 3.1%, while same-store sales slipped 1.6% at the Sears chain and 4.8% at Kmart. Sears Canada's same store sales also declined by 5.7%. Shares -6% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:40 PM
  • GPS

    More on Gap (NYSE:GPS): Q3 earnings came in line on a per share basis but beat on revenue as...

    More on Gap (NYSE:GPS): Q3 earnings came in line on a per share basis but beat on revenue as total sales increased 8% over the prior year. Net profit jumped 60% on stronger margins and growing same-store sales in North America. Gross margin widened to 41.2% from 36.7% as input costs remained steady, but operating expenses rose 11%. The company raised its FY12 earnings view, now seeing $2.20 to $2.25 a share, up from its August view of $1.95 to $2.00. Shares +3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:24 PM
  • ARUN

    Aruba Networks (NASDAQ:ARUN) guides on its FQ1 call for FQ2 revenue of $150M-$153M and EPS of...

    Aruba Networks (NASDAQ:ARUN) guides on its FQ1 call for FQ2 revenue of $150M-$153M and EPS of $0.19 - the latter is only in-line, but the former is above a $148.9M consensus. Shares +5.2% AH. Both Aruba and archrival Cisco are seeing strong enterprise and service provider Wi-Fi demand. This could bode well for Ruckus Wireless, which is set to go public under the symbol RKUS.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:14 PM
  • DVAX

    Dynavax Technologies (NASDAQ:DVAX) plummets over 60% in heavy volume after-hours following the...

    Dynavax Technologies (NASDAQ:DVAX) plummets over 60% in heavy volume after-hours following the stock's release from a trading halt. Earlier, the company announced that the FDA Vaccines Advisory Committee had voted 13-1 that Heplisav data adequately demonstrated immunogenicity, but the committee also voted 8-5 with one abstention that there was insufficient data to adequately support the safety of the drug.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:12 PM | 2 Comments
  • SINA

    More on SINA (NASDAQ:SINA): Q3 beats on both EPS and revenue expectations as total revenue...

    More on SINA (NASDAQ:SINA): Q3 beats on both EPS and revenue expectations as total revenue increase by 18% Y/Y. The company lowers Q4 guidance however, on a decline in non-advertising revenues due to new operator policies to reduce customer complaints. It now sees revenue between $132M - $136M. The Street view is for $155M in revenue. Shares -2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:50 PM
  • SINA

    Sina (NASDAQ:SINA): Q3 EPS of $0.17 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $147.7M (+18% Y/Y) beats by...

    Sina (NASDAQ:SINA): Q3 EPS of $0.17 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $147.7M (+18% Y/Y) beats by $1.7M. Shares -8.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM
  • VIEW

    Cogo Group (COGO): Q3 EPS of $0.11 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $216.4M (+47.8% Y/Y) beats by...

    Cogo Group (COGO): Q3 EPS of $0.11 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $216.4M (+47.8% Y/Y) beats by $12M. Shares +11% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM
  • SHLDQ

    Sears (SHLD): Q3 EPS of -$1.99 beats by $0.19. Revenue of $8.86B beats by $270M. Shares -4.3%...

    Sears (SHLD): Q3 EPS of -$1.99 beats by $0.19. Revenue of $8.86B beats by $270M. Shares -4.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM | 2 Comments
  • HAYN

    Haynes International (NASDAQ:HAYN): FQ4 EPS of $1.04 misses by $0.07. Revenue of $150.3M beats...

    Haynes International (NASDAQ:HAYN): FQ4 EPS of $1.04 misses by $0.07. Revenue of $150.3M beats by $7M. Shares +1.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM
  • MRVL

    Marvell Technology Group (NASDAQ:MRVL): Q3 EPS of $0.20 in-line. Revenue of $780.9M (-18% Y/Y)...

    Marvell Technology Group (NASDAQ:MRVL): Q3 EPS of $0.20 in-line. Revenue of $780.9M (-18% Y/Y) beats by $6M. Shares +2.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • ARUN

    Aruba Networks (NASDAQ:ARUN): FQ1 EPS of $0.18 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $144.5M (+21% Y/Y)...

    Aruba Networks (NASDAQ:ARUN): FQ1 EPS of $0.18 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $144.5M (+21% Y/Y) beats by $2M. Shares +1.8% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • ADSK

    Autodesk (NASDAQ:ADSK): Q3 EPS of $0.47 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $548M (flat% Y/Y) misses by...

    Autodesk (NASDAQ:ADSK): Q3 EPS of $0.47 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $548M (flat% Y/Y) misses by $12M. Shares -6.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • GPS

    Gap (NYSE:GPS): Q3 EPS of $0.63 in-line. Revenue of $3.86B (+8% Y/Y) beats by $40M. Shares +2.8%...

    Gap (NYSE:GPS): Q3 EPS of $0.63 in-line. Revenue of $3.86B (+8% Y/Y) beats by $40M. Shares +2.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM
  • DDD

    3D Systems (DDD -9.1%) is finishing with big losses yet again. Shares are down 18% on the week,...

    3D Systems (DDD -9.1%) is finishing with big losses yet again. Shares are down 18% on the week, thanks in no small part to accounting concerns. Stratasys (SSYS -2.6%) is also lower. A CNET column this morning discussed remarks from industry experts about the future of 3D printing. "We're still living in a bubble a little bit," declared the CEO of 3D printing marketplace Shapeways, due to the fact the average person still isn't aware of what 3D printers can accomplish.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:00 PM | 4 Comments
  • SAVE

    Spirit Airlines (SAVE +8.2%) is raised to Outperform by Raymond James, which thinks worries...

    Spirit Airlines (SAVE +8.2%) is raised to Outperform by Raymond James, which thinks worries about the impact of Hurricane Sandy are overblown and that Street estimates are now more reasonable. The firm likes SAVE’s strategy of entering high density markets controlled by legacy carriers, and using its lower cost structure to cut average fares by ~25% while realizing a ~13% operating margin.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • CALI

    Shares of China Auto Logistics (OTC:CALI +45%) soar today after the seller of luxury imported...

    Shares of China Auto Logistics (OTC:CALI +45%) soar today after the seller of luxury imported automobiles in China reported a 78.3% year-over-year increase in Q3 sales. Automobile Sales revenues jumped by 83.4%, led by a 130% jump in Luxury Auto sales, while Financing Services sales rose by 22%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM
  • REPYY

    Repsol (OTCQX:REPYY +4.6%) shares jump after Spanish Foreign Minister Jose Manuel...

    Repsol (OTCQX:REPYY +4.6%) shares jump after Spanish Foreign Minister Jose Manuel Garcia-Margallo reportedly predicted his government will reach a deal with Argentina over YPF, the oil producer's Argentine unit which was expropriated in April. Under the World Bank process Repsol initiated in May, Argentina has six months to negotiate a settlement.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 PM
  • ENDP

    Notes from Endo Health's (ENDP +4.3%) presentation at Credit Suisse's annual Healthcare...

    Notes from Endo Health's (ENDP +4.3%) presentation at Credit Suisse's annual Healthcare Conference: Reaffirms FY12 outlook given on November 5, sees Q4 EPS $1.58 - $1.68, at the high range of Street consensus at $1.60. Peak sales in Opana ER are expected to be in excess of $800M. (Webcast)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM
  • OSIS

    OSI Systems' (OSIS -34.1%) Rapiscan security business is under scrutiny for possibly providing...

    OSI Systems' (OSIS -34.1%) Rapiscan security business is under scrutiny for possibly providing false privacy data on its full-body scanners to the TSA. "Rapiscan did not falsify test data," OSIS responds. "In fact, TSA testimony to Congress today confirms that this was at all times a government controlled test and that Rapiscan could not have manipulated any test data."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM | 3 Comments
  • FANG

    Diamondback Energy (FANG +4.5%) is initiated at C.K. Cooper with a Buy rating and $26 price...

    Diamondback Energy (FANG +4.5%) is initiated at C.K. Cooper with a Buy rating and $26 price target. The firm likes FANG's strong history of drilling success with a success rate over 90%, and sees significant upside as the company accelerates its operated vertical and horizontal programs exclusively targeting oil bearing formations.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM
  • DGSE

    Shares of DGSE Companies (NYSEMKT:DGSE) resumed trading today on the NYSE after being halted...

    Shares of DGSE Companies (NYSEMKT:DGSE) resumed trading today on the NYSE after being halted nearly seven months ago - and have already tumbled 31.4%. Trading was halted in the shares on April 17, as a result of the company's discovery of accounting irregularities and it's inability to comply with certain information disclosure requirements of the stock exchange.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM
  • IAG

    IAMGOLD (IAG -4.8%) is downgraded by at least four sell-side firms, including Credit Suisse,...

    IAMGOLD (IAG -4.8%) is downgraded by at least four sell-side firms, including Credit Suisse, which cuts its 2013 production forecasts after IAG's weak Q3 and sees further downside risk in 2014-15 with no major positive catalysts on the horizon. BMO cuts against the grain, however, raising its rating in the belief the stock's pullback is overdone.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM
  • AKAM

    Akamai (AKAM +3.1%) has caught a bid after cancelling its Dec. 12 analyst day and reaffirming...

    Akamai (AKAM +3.1%) has caught a bid after cancelling its Dec. 12 analyst day and reaffirming its Q4 guidance. The company says it will reschedule the meeting after it has "named and transitioned to" a new CEO - that's an odd remark, given current CEO Paul Sagan has only said he'd leave by the end of 2013. M&A speculators, a group that's quite familiar with Akamai shares, appear to be jumping on the news.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:09 PM
  • CSIQ

    It's still no fun to be a solar manufacturer. Canadian Solar (CSIQ -14%) is seeing huge losses...

    It's still no fun to be a solar manufacturer. Canadian Solar (CSIQ -14%) is seeing huge losses following its big Q3 miss, which is contributing to yet another sector rout (TAN -3.6%). Canadian's gross margin fell to a mere 2.2%, and would likely have been negative if not for its efforts (similar to those of peers) to expand into plant construction. The company expects to ship 380MW-420MW of modules in Q4, compared with 384MW in Q3, and record a gross margin of 1%-3%. (yesterday) (transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:55 PM | 2 Comments
  • GTATQ

    LED/solar equipment maker GT Advanced (GTAT -5.8%) and LED wafer firm Rubicon (RBCN -3.3%) are...

    LED/solar equipment maker GT Advanced (GTAT -5.8%) and LED wafer firm Rubicon (RBCN -3.3%) are both making new lows today. Veeco's delayed 10-Q could be playing a role, but sentiment towards both companies was already pretty negative thanks to bad earnings news (I, II) and poor industry demand.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM | 1 Comment
  • WPRT

    Westport Innovations (WPRT -3%) bows to market pressure today, ignoring Deutsche's initiation of...

    Westport Innovations (WPRT -3%) bows to market pressure today, ignoring Deutsche's initiation of the the shares with a Buy rating and $38 target price. Deutsche says the natural gas vehicle market has reached an inflection point as infrastructure bottlenecks have been eliminated the technology garners greater interest. Additionally, HPDI engine prices are down 25% from a year ago, which should spur buyers and give a boost to sales, and the company has multiple new products set to debut next year.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM | 3 Comments
  • RCON

    Midday top 10 gainers: RCON +91%. BXG +55%. OTC:CALI +45%. SGOC +44%. OTC:BGMD +22%. MEET +21%....

    Midday top 10 gainers: RCON +91%. BXG +55%. OTC:CALI +45%. SGOC +44%. OTC:BGMD +22%. MEET +21%. ACRX +15%. SZYM +13%. DANG +12%. SGYP +11%. Midday top 10 Losers: TZYM -75%. FFEX -48%. TRIT -38%. OTC:ATEA -35%. SB -34%. VELT -34%. NAII -25%. OSIS -24%. UTSI -23%. DMND -22%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • ZNGA

    Zynga (ZNGA +7.5%) is posting big gains two days after its huge management shakeup - Paul Tudor...

    Zynga (ZNGA +7.5%) is posting big gains two days after its huge management shakeup - Paul Tudor Jones' vote of confidence could have something to do with it. This morning, Zynga announced a mobile version of its Ruby Blast artifact-collecting game. The company also says it plans to bring Bubble Safari to mobile devices.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM | 1 Comment
  • CAM

    Cameron (CAM +3.4%) sees its deal with Schlumberger (SLB +1.2%) to jointly develop and...

    Cameron (CAM +3.4%) sees its deal with Schlumberger (SLB +1.2%) to jointly develop and manufacture products for the subsea oil and gas market as “game-changing," and analysts are just as effusive. “Improving recoveries from reservoirs has been the holy grail forever, and if there was a better marriage to find that holy grail, it’s hard to figure out what it is," Credit Suisse says.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM | 3 Comments
  • TDG

    TransDigm Group (TDG -4.1%) slips today after its FQ4 missed estimates across the board. The...

    TransDigm Group (TDG -4.1%) slips today after its FQ4 missed estimates across the board. The company also issued a downbeat view for FY13. It now forecasts its EPS to come in around $6.54 - $6.98 on revenues of $1.8B - $1.9B. The Street view is for an EPS of $7.58 on revenues of $1.95B. The stock has been hammered over the past few weeks due to concerns about a potential sequestration if the fiscal cliff issue isn't resolved. The company's products include military aircraft components, and the already deep Pentagon budget cuts are liable to get worse if that happens.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:21 PM
  • MEOH

    Methanex (MEOH -2.1%) says it has secured further long-term gas supplies in New Zealand, which...

    Methanex (MEOH -2.1%) says it has secured further long-term gas supplies in New Zealand, which equate to ~2.5M metric tons of methanol production over the next five years. CEO Bruce Aitken says the new gas, combined with the 10-year agreement signed earlier this year, underpins long term production at its Motunui site.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:08 PM
  • NTAP

    Raymond James has upgraded NetApp (NTAP +10.6%) to Outperform following yesterday's FQ2 beat (I,...

    Raymond James has upgraded NetApp (NTAP +10.6%) to Outperform following yesterday's FQ2 beat (I, II): the firm expects growth to pick up thanks to product refreshes, new partnerships, and stronger flash memory integration. Goldman sees the report as evidence enterprise IT spending is stabilizing after a tough Q3, though it likes EMC (EMC +0.2%) better. During its earnings call, NetApp mentioned it saw a 20% Y/Y increase in $1M+ deals; the company is trying to boost its high-end presence with the help of new clustering capabilities.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:05 PM
  • SNE

    Sony (SNE +0.5%) CEO Kazuo Hirai doubles down on his plan to grow business lines with a new bond...

    Sony (SNE +0.5%) CEO Kazuo Hirai doubles down on his plan to grow business lines with a new bond issue that rattled investors in Japan and the U.S. Barclays analyst Yujii Fujimori says a key focus for the company will be how quickly it can churn up profits from its mobile phone business.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM
  • SD

    A second major SandRidge Energy (SD +5.6%) investor calls for the company to replace CEO Tom...

    A second major SandRidge Energy (SD +5.6%) investor calls for the company to replace CEO Tom Ward and overhaul its board. Mount Kellett Capital, which owns ~4.5% of SD’s shares, says SD "has great assets and should be a great company, but it is clear that it will not be without changes at the top." Shares have been volatile since TPG-Axon criticized SD last week.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM | 4 Comments
  • NTES

    NetEase (NTES -6.6%) slumps after reporting Q3 revenue of $325.4M (flat Y/Y) and EPS of $0.98,...

    NetEase (NTES -6.6%) slumps after reporting Q3 revenue of $325.4M (flat Y/Y) and EPS of $0.98, missing consensus by $8.3M and $0.09. Online gaming revenue (85% of total) fell a bit while advertising and value-added service revenue rose. Opex surged 23% Y/Y to $85.5M thanks in part to higher gave development R&D and promotional spending. A new $100M stock repurchase program (good for buying back 1.6% of outstanding shares at current levels) has been authorized. (PR) (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM
  • BP

    Environmental penalties remain unresolved in BP's (BP +1.5%) expected settlement with the DOJ...

    Environmental penalties remain unresolved in BP's (BP +1.5%) expected settlement with the DOJ and SEC over the 2010 Gulf of Mexico spill, as BP could be liable for a maximum penalty of $5.4B under the Clean Water Act, rising to as much as $21B if gross negligence is found. Total outstanding liabilities still have the potential to exceed the $38B charge BP has booked so far for the disaster.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM | 3 Comments
  • VELTF

    Velti (VELT -31.5%) has crumbled after missing Q3 EPS forecasts and stating it's abandoning...

    Velti (VELT -31.5%) has crumbled after missing Q3 EPS forecasts and stating it's abandoning markets where collection times have risen to stratospheric levels. During its earnings call, Velti noted Americas sales rose 81% Y/Y and U.K. sales (boosted by MIG) 221%, but the rest of Europe (includes some markets Velti is leaving) rose only 22%. Jefferies (Buy) likes the fact "management ripped off the band-aid via a divestiture," but thinks shares will be pressured near-term. Millennial Media (MM +5%) opened lower, but is now recouping some of yesterday's big losses.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM
  • SLB

    Schlumberger (SLB +1.3%) and Cameron International (CAM +3.4%) say they will form a JV to make...

    Schlumberger (SLB +1.3%) and Cameron International (CAM +3.4%) say they will form a JV to make products, systems and services for the subsea oil and gas market. CAM, which will manage the JV, will contribute its existing subsea business and receive $600M from SLB. SLB will contribute its Framo, surveillance, flow assurance and power and controls businesses.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM
  • RIOT

    AspenBio Pharma (APPY -13.8%) falls after pricing its previously announced secondary offering of...

    AspenBio Pharma (APPY -13.8%) falls after pricing its previously announced secondary offering of 1.5M shares at $2.10 each, a 15% discount to Wednesday's close. The diagnostic-product developer has a 7.7M share float outstanding at the beginning of November.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM
  • VECO

    LED/solar equipment maker Veeco (VECO -7.2%) is off sharply after stating it will delay the...

    LED/solar equipment maker Veeco (VECO -7.2%) is off sharply after stating it will delay the filing of its Q3 10-Q. Veeco says it needs more time to evaluate revenue recognition timing for its costly MOCVD LED manufacturing systems. CEO John Peeler claims the systems in question have all been paid in full. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM
  • XSPA

    Vringo (VRNG -3.5%) is down a bit after delivering its Q3 report yesterday afternoon. Revenue...

    Vringo (VRNG -3.5%) is down a bit after delivering its Q3 report yesterday afternoon. Revenue amounted to $266K and net loss totaled $3.1M, or $0.06/share. Vringo noted it had over $60M in cash as of Nov. 14, thanks to its recent stock offering. The IP holder noted on its earnings call its Vringo Labs subsidiary came up with 9 "provisional patents" during the quarter, one of which covers wireless energy. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:01 AM

  • Gold slides 1.1% amidst the World Gold Council reporting an 11% Y/Y decline in Q3 demand to 1.1K...

    Gold slides 1.1% amidst the World Gold Council reporting an 11% Y/Y decline in Q3 demand to 1.1K metric tons. Central banks remained steady buyers, but investment demand - ETPs, bars, coins - was off 16% Y/Y. The WGC notes 2011 Q3 is a tough comparison, and demand remains well above the 5-year average of 984.7 metric tons.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:01 AM | 12 Comments
  • LPIH

    Longwei Petroleum (LPH +1.9%) signs sales agreements with seven major customers for its Huajie...

    Longwei Petroleum (LPH +1.9%) signs sales agreements with seven major customers for its Huajie storage facility in China, bringing the total since operations began in early October to 16 new customers. LPH says it has 46 major customers at its Taiyuan and Gujiao facilities.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM
  • WPRT

    Westport Innovations (WPRT +1.6%) is initiated with a Buy rating at Deutsche Bank, which sees an...

    Westport Innovations (WPRT +1.6%) is initiated with a Buy rating at Deutsche Bank, which sees an inflection point for natural gas vehicles from 2013 as engine technology advances. The firm believes shares have discounted near-term macro headwinds after WPRT's recent guidance revision and sees "potential for multiple catalysts on the horizon."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM
  • KO

    Though Monster Beverage is the stock feeling the aftershocks from the 5-Hour Energy government...

    Though Monster Beverage is the stock feeling the aftershocks from the 5-Hour Energy government inquiry, both Coca-Cola (NYSE:KO) and PepsiCo (NYSE:PEP) could feel a mild tremor or two if health risks continue to be a major topic. Tapping into the explosive growth of the energy drink market is a key part of the firms' plans to grow beverage revenue.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:43 AM
  • AKS

    AK Steel (AKS -6.2%) sinks at the open amid pending stock and bond sales (I, II, III) that...

    AK Steel (AKS -6.2%) sinks at the open amid pending stock and bond sales (I, II, III) that include boosting the amount of stock outstanding by more than 20%. Wells Fargo analysts, however, note the sales will give AKS~$1.2B of liquidity, “adequate enough to ride out a choppy macro and fund forays into iron-ore/coal mining to improve the cost structure.”

     
     
     
     
    | 9:35 AM
  • MNST

    Shares of Monster Beverage (NASDAQ:MNST) lose their buzz to fall 4.5% premarket after questions...

    Shares of Monster Beverage (NASDAQ:MNST) lose their buzz to fall 4.5% premarket after questions are raised in the industry over upstart 5-Hour Energy. The government says it's in receipt of allegations that 13 deaths could be related to the caffeine-laced shot of energy. In addition, 5-Hour Energy is mentioned in an adverse manner in more than 90 filings with the FDA.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM
  • OCRX

    Tranzyme (TZYM) -66% premarket after reporting negative preliminary results from the first of...

    Tranzyme (TZYM) -66% premarket after reporting negative preliminary results from the first of two trials assessing its TZP-102 treatment for diabetic patients with a common stomach complication. Neither the 10mg dose group nor the 20mg dose group of TZP-102 patients reached statistical significance vs. a placebo.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM
  • DANG

    Shares of of E-Commerce China Dangdang (NYSE:DANG) run up a 13.6% gain premarket again after the...

    Shares of of E-Commerce China Dangdang (NYSE:DANG) run up a 13.6% gain premarket again after the company reports Q3 earnings. An optimistic lift in guidance from the e-commerce player has caught the attention of traders.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:23 AM

  • Market preview: Stock futures bounce around above and below zero following a data dump earlier,...

    Market preview: Stock futures bounce around above and below zero following a data dump earlier, including a Sandy induced jump in weekly jobless claims. The S&P benchmark is flat. Europe is almost solidly red, though, with the eurozone's entry into a double-dip recession dragging on shares. Following earnings, Wal-Mart is -3.1%. Later: Philly Fed Business Outlook, Bernanke, Plosser
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • BBXT

    Premarket gainers: BXG +68%. ACRX +31%. DANG +14%. NTAP +12%. ELOQ +12%. AMRN +7%. LPH +7%....

    Premarket gainers: BXG +68%. ACRX +31%. DANG +14%. NTAP +12%. ELOQ +12%. AMRN +7%. LPH +7%.
    Losers: VELT -27%. DMND -23%. APPY -17%. TDG -6%. AKS -5%. DRYS -5%. VGR -5%. NGLS -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • ACRX

    AcelRx Pharma (NASDAQ:ACRX) surges 25% after saying that its under-the-tongue NanoTab system for...

    AcelRx Pharma (NASDAQ:ACRX) surges 25% after saying that its under-the-tongue NanoTab system for relieving pain after surgery came out on top in a direct head-to-head with morphine in a Phase III trial. Patients loved it and so did nurses. NanoTab system is being tested in two other late-stage studies. (PR)
